Name: Drakensberg
Units: generate electricity for 10 hours with all 4 units per day, pump water back to the top dam for 9 hours with all 4 units per day. A pumped storage scheme generates electricity during peak hours, which is everyday when the demand of electricity rises. During the off-peak periods Drakensberg will use its reversible turbines to pump the water back to the upper reservoir, readying the system for peak periods. 4 x 250MW generating sets - Installed capacity 1000 MW - Nominal operating head of 450m - Average availability over last 3 years: 93, 88% - Average production over last 3 years: 2041 GWh - Average import (pumping) over last 3 years: 2766 GWh
